content: charts for better visualization the the motif has a few long floats at the beginning but floats are present also later because skyscrapers windows are in every second round to ensure elasticity i strongly suggest lbj technique with additional stitches at every fifth stitch beginning with the third stitch after the bridge suggested positions of lbj are marked in the chart 5 skyscrapers swim the skyscrapers motif is easy to change one can add skyscrapers in front of existing ones make them higher for a longer leg and similar when i knitted this motif for the first time i did not use a chart i simply added � ��one� building here one building there but i must admit their orientation was for the owner not for the public skyscrapers were knit bottom up and were placed near the toes heels the heels are formed from a triangular inset with increases which start at the pavement in front of the skyscrapers that is in the middle of the back leg in the first round below the skyscrapers the motif continues to the street in front of skyscrapers with pavements on both sides and further with huge stones defending the street from sea waves however to make the heel inset clear it is drawn separately in chart b one chart for the part that finally forms sock 1 and one for sock 2 each size the light blue lines indicate the instep work the first round of chart b sock 2 first add two heel markers for the first heel one before the double yarnover stitches the right heel-marker and one after them the left heel-marker in the middle of the back of the leg then work the first round of chart b sock 1 add two heel-markers for the second heel one before the double yarnover stitches the right heel-marker and one after them the left heel-marker in the middle of the back of the leg the triangular heel is formed between the heel-markers the m1r is always worked just after the right heel-marker and the m1l is worked just before the left heel-marker continue following chart b for sock 2 followed by chart b for sock 1 slipping the markers when you get to them change to colour c when indicated in the chart stop ahfeteerl rtu2r7n r29 r31 of charts b the heel turns stay hidden in the sole when a person is sta nding and area wreo rked in colour a they are integrated between the two white rounds with the instep pattern that is the last two lines in charts b for socks 2 and 1 theheel stitches worked back and forth they are not given in the chart except for the first two row marked by a rectangle c s start the round in colour a work bridge 1 and continue working the r28 r30 r32 of hart b ock 2 the transition to the heel turn is indicated in chart b sock 2 in the
